articles.headline: A Killing. A Pointed Gun. And Two Black Lives, Witnessing.
articles.snippet: A live stream on Facebook takes us into a car where a fatal police shooting occurred, emphasizing the gulf between virtual and physical presence.
articles.abstract: A live stream on Facebook takes us into a car where a fatal police shooting occurred, emphasizing the gulf between virtual and physical presence.

articles.headline: Growing Unease as British Mutual Funds Block the Exit Doors
articles.snippet: The refusal of six asset management firms to allow investor withdrawals is creating a nightmare situation for global markets.
articles.abstract: The refusal of six asset management firms to allow investor withdrawals is creating a nightmare situation for global markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: As one British mutual fund after another bars its doors to fleeing investors, traders and regulators alike are asking the same question: What does it mean for nervous global markets?

articles.headline: Gretchen Carlson Suit Against Fox News Head Forces Network to Face Changing Mores
articles.snippet: Facing a gender discrimination suit against its chairman, Fox is being swept by societal forces that are defying old behaviors long abetted by silence.
articles.abstract: Facing a gender discrimination suit against its chairman, Fox is being swept by societal forces that are defying old behaviors long abetted by silence.
articles.lead_paragraph: At a time of fast-moving social change, Fox News can at times be viewed as a port in a storm for traditionalists who pine for the way we were — for the days when there was no gay marriage; no terms like “gender fluidity”; no doubt about the roles men and women were supposed to play and certainly no talk about the liberties men might take with female subordinates behind closed doors.

articles.headline: Public Colleges Chase Out-of-State Students, and Tuition
articles.snippet: Since the 2008 recession, states have reduced spending on public higher education by 17 percent, creating questions of affordability and access.
articles.abstract: Since the 2008 recession, states have reduced spending on public higher education by 17 percent, creating questions of affordability and access.
articles.lead_paragraph: SACRAMENTO — Over three generations, the Michael family forged a deep bond with the University of California, dating back nearly 50 years to when Jay Dee Michael Sr. was the university system’s vice president and chief lobbyist.

articles.headline: Elizabeth Holmes of Theranos Is Barred From Running Lab for 2 Years
articles.snippet: Regulators also revoked the operating license of a Theranos lab and levied a fine. The sanctions were a major setback for the blood-testing start-up.
articles.abstract: Regulators also revoked the operating license of a Theranos lab and levied a fine. The sanctions were a major setback for the blood-testing start-up.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal regulators have barred Elizabeth Holmes, chief executive of Theranos, from owning or operating a medical laboratory for at least two years, raising new questions about the future of the embattled blood-testing start-up and its founder, once a Silicon Valley phenomenon.

articles.headline: Jobs Roar Back With Gain of 287,000 in June, Easing Worry
articles.snippet: After a grim employment report in May, the economy showed new life, tamping down some concerns about an economic slowdown.
articles.abstract: After a grim employment report in May, the economy showed new life, tamping down some concerns about an economic slowdown.
articles.lead_paragraph: Quashing worries that job growth is flagging, the government on Friday reported that employers increased payrolls by 287,000 in June, an arresting surge that could reframe the economic debate just weeks before Republicans and Democrats gather for their conventions.

articles.headline: Five Dallas Officers Were Killed as Payback, Police Chief Says
articles.snippet: The shooting rampage committed by Micah Johnson, 25, was described as the kind of retaliatory violence that people have feared for the last two years.
articles.abstract: The shooting rampage committed by Micah Johnson, 25, was described as the kind of retaliatory violence that people have feared for the last two years.
articles.lead_paragraph: DALLAS — The heavily armed sniper who gunned down police officers in downtown Dallas, leaving five of them dead, specifically set out to kill as many white officers as he could, officials said Friday. He was a military veteran who had served in Afghanistan, and he kept an arsenal in his home that included bomb-making materials.
articles.byline: By Manny Fernandez, Richard Pérez-Peña and Jonah Engel Bromwich

articles.headline: Facebook to Add ‘Secret Conversations’ to Messenger App
articles.snippet: The app has long taken a back seat to the social media giant’s WhatsApp, but Facebook hopes the service will attract a global audience.
articles.abstract: The app has long taken a back seat to the social media giant’s WhatsApp, but Facebook hopes the service will attract a global audience.
articles.lead_paragraph: MENLO PARK, Calif. — Two years ago, Messenger, a photo and text messaging service, appeared to be almost an afterthought at Facebook, the social networking giant.

articles.headline: What the Seesaw Jobs Numbers Are Really Telling Us
articles.snippet: The labor market is what we thought it was: It’s not terrific; it’s not terrible. It’s just fine.
articles.abstract: The labor market is what we thought it was: It’s not terrific; it’s not terrible. It’s just fine.

articles.headline: A More Personal Hillary Clinton Tries to Erase a Trust Deficit
articles.snippet: Mrs. Clinton has slowly owned up to the trustworthiness problem. But it will take more than acknowledgment to fix the issue.
articles.abstract: Mrs. Clinton has slowly owned up to the trustworthiness problem. But it will take more than acknowledgment to fix the issue.
articles.lead_paragraph: For most of her presidential campaign, whenever Hillary Clinton has been confronted with polls showing that a majority of voters do not trust her, she has attributed the problem to decades of wild Republican attacks and right-wing conspiracy theories.

articles.headline: From Fallen Presidential Candidates, Bold Money Ideas Worth Another Look
articles.snippet: Jeb Bush’s ideas on student loans, Bernie Sanders’s on credit scores and Marco Rubio’s on retirement investing offer improvement and needn’t cost taxpayers much.
articles.abstract: Jeb Bush’s ideas on student loans, Bernie Sanders’s on credit scores and Marco Rubio’s on retirement investing offer improvement and needn’t cost taxpayers much.
articles.lead_paragraph: Welcome to the season of the big, political personal finance promises.

articles.headline: Investors Get Stung Twice by Executives’ Lavish Pay Packages
articles.snippet: Shareholders suffer when generous stock grants dilute the value of their stakes, and then again when companies buy back stock to counter that dilution.
articles.abstract: Shareholders suffer when generous stock grants dilute the value of their stakes, and then again when companies buy back stock to counter that dilution.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s a frustrating fact of life for many mutual fund investors: Even if they’re distressed by outsize executive compensation at public companies whose shares they indirectly own, chances are good that the votes cast by their investment managers actually encourage delusional pay.
